Package org.jsfml.graphics

Class Glyph

java.lang.Object
org.jsfml.graphics.Glyph
public final class Glyph extends Object
Describes a glyph in a Font.
See Also:
  • Font

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    final int
    advance
    The offset to move horizontally to the next character.
    final IntRect
    bounds
    The bounding rectangle of the glyph, in coordinates relative to the baseline.
    final IntRect
    textureRect
    The texture coordinates of the glyph on the font's texture.

  • Field Details

    • advance

      public final int advance
      The offset to move horizontally to the next character.

    • bounds

      public final IntRect bounds
      The bounding rectangle of the glyph, in coordinates relative to the baseline.

    • textureRect

      public final IntRect textureRect
      The texture coordinates of the glyph on the font's texture.

  • Constructor Details

    • Glyph

      public Glyph(int advance, IntRect bounds, IntRect textureRect)
      Constructs a glyph with the specified parameters.

      Note that this constructor is reserved for internal use and should never be required to be used directly. Glyphs should be obtained using the Font.getGlyph(int, int, boolean) method.

      Parameters:
      advance - the offset to move horizontally to the next character.
      bounds - the boundaries of the glyph.
      textureRect - the texture rectangle used by the glyph.
      See Also:
      • Font.getGlyph(int, int, boolean)
